title: "Malin's Richness Temp Plot"
output: html_notebook
---

```{r setup}
require(data.table)
require(lme4)

load('data/comm_data/comm_master.RData')
```

```{r plot}
trend <- function(y, x){
	return(coef(lm(y ~ x))[2])
}

scale <- function(x){
	return((x-mean(x))/sd(x))
}


comm_master[reg=='neus',plot(year, reg_rich, type='o')]

# add trends and other vars
comm_master[,bt_trend:=trend(bt_ann,year), by=reg]
comm_master[,bt_trend_abs:=abs(bt_trend)]
comm_master[,bt_trend_abs_sc:=scale(bt_trend_abs)]
comm_master[,year_sc:=scale(year)]

# create summary data
trends <- comm_master[,.(rich=trend(reg_rich, year), temp=trend(bt_ann,year)), by=reg]

setkey(comm_master, reg, year)
fd <- comm_master[,.(fyear=year[1:(.N-1)], richdiff=c(diff(reg_rich)), btdiff=c(diff(bt_ann))),by=reg]


# statistics
mod <- trends[,lm(rich ~ abs(temp))]
summary(mod)

mod2 <- fd[,lmer(richdiff ~ abs(btdiff) + (1|reg))]
summary(mod2)

mod3 <- comm_master[,lmer(reg_rich ~ year_sc + bt_trend_abs_sc + year_sc:bt_trend_abs_sc + (year_sc|reg))]
summary(mod3)
mod3b <- comm_master[,lmer(reg_rich ~ year_sc + bt_trend_abs_sc + (year_sc|reg))]
anova(mod3, mod3b)



# plot
quartz(width=5, height=4)
# pdf(width=5, height=4, file='figures/richnesstrend_vs_temperaturetrend.pdf')
par(las=1, mai=c(1,1,0.2, 0.2))
trends[,plot(abs(temp), rich, pch=16, cex=2, col='#1f78b4', ylab='Change in richness (spp/yr)', xlab='abs(Temperature trend) (Â°C/yr)')]
trends[,abline(mod, col='grey', lty=2)]

dev.off()
```
